action.action-desc: Mr. Stivers (for himself and Mr. Loebsack) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Education and Labor, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act to meet the needs of homeless children, youth, and families, and honor the assessments and priorities of local communities.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Homeless Children and Youth Act of 2019.

section.header: Amendments to the McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act

subsection.text: The McKinney-Vento Homeless Assistance Act is amended—

paragraph.text: in section 103 (42 U.S.C. 11302)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (a)—

clause.text: in paragraph (5)(A)—

subclause.text: by striking are sharing and all that follows through charitable organizations,;
by striking 14 days each place such term appears and inserting 30 days;
in clause (i), by inserting or after the semicolon;
by redesignating clause (iii) as clause (ii); and

clause.text: by amending paragraph (6) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: a child or youth defined as homeless under any other Federal program who, without further action by the Department of Housing and Urban Development, has been verified as homeless under any other Federal program by the director, designee of the director, or other person responsible for the implementation of a program established under this Act or any other Federal statute.

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: the term child or youth defined as homeless under any other Federal program has the meaning given the term in section 401; and
the term other Federal statute has the meaning given the term in section 401.

subsection.text: If the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development promulgates rules, issues guidance, or sets forth conditions in any application, notice of funding availability, or other publication or advisory regarding the provisions of this Act, the Secretary shall ensure that—

paragraph.text: any individual defined as homeless under section 103 is eligible for any program or program component under this Act; and

all individuals defined as homeless under subsection (a) proposed to be served by an applicant, and all proposed program components or housing or service models, are given the same priority, points, or weight.

paragraph.header: Child or youth defined as homeless under any other Federal program
paragraph.text: The term child or youth defined as homeless under any other Federal program means—

subparagraph.text: a homeless child or youth, as defined in section 725, including any parent or guardian with whom the child or youth is living; and
a youth who—

clause.text: is not more than 24 years of age;
cannot live safely with a parent, legal guardian, or relative; and
has no other safe alternative living arrangement.

paragraph.text: by inserting after section 408 (42 U.S.C. 11364) the following:

subsection.text: The community-wide homeless management information system (in this section referred to as HMIS) data provided to the Secretary under section 402(f)(3)(D)(vi) shall be made publically available on the Internet website of the Department of Housing and Urban Development.
The data publically available under subsection (a) shall be updated on at least an annual basis and shall include—

paragraph.text: a cumulative count of the number of homeless individuals and families, as defined under any provision of section 103;
a cumulative assessment of the patterns of assistance provided under subtitles B and C for each geographic area involved;
a count of the number of homeless individuals and families, as defined under any provision of section 103, that are documented through the HMIS by each collaborative applicant; and
a count of the number of homeless women, as defined under any provision of section 103 and both unaccompanied and accompanied, including a breakout of the count by—

subparagraph.text: age range;
disability; and
length of time experiencing homelessness.

paragraph.text: in section 422 (42 U.S.C. 11382)—

subsection.text: In awarding grants under subsection (a) and releasing a notification of funding availability under subsection (b), the Secretary shall—

paragraph.text: without further action by the Department, ensure that any individual defined as homeless under any provision of section 103 is eligible for any program or program component under this Act;
ensure that homeless populations proposed to be served by the applicant, and proposed program components or housing or service models, are not awarded different priority, points, or weight; and
ensure that scoring is based primarily on the extent to which the applicant demonstrates that the project and program components—

subparagraph.text: would meet the priorities identified in the plan submitted under section 427(b)(1)(B); and
are cost-effective in meeting the overall goals and objectives identified in that plan.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (4), by amending subparagraph (D) to read as follows:
in the case of programs providing housing or services to families or youth, they will designate a staff person to be responsible for ensuring that children and youth being served in the program are—

clause.text: enrolled in school and connected to appropriate services in the community, including Head Start, part C of the Individuals with Disabilities Act, programs authorized under the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990, career and technical education, and services provided by local educational agency liaisons designated under subtitle B of title VII of this Act; and

in the case of an unaccompanied youth, as defined in section 725, informed of their status as an independent student under section 480 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087vv) and receive verification of such status for purposes of the Free Application for Federal Student Aid described in section 483 of such Act (20 U.S.C. 1090); and

clause.text: in subparagraph (A)—

subclause.text: by amending clause (iii) to read as follows:

clause.text: how the recipient will collaborate with local educational agencies, early care and education programs, and institutions of higher education to assist in the identification of and services to youth and families who become or remain homeless, including the steps the recipient will take to inform youth and families of their eligibility for services under part B of subtitle VII of this Act, the Head Start Act (42 U.S.C. 9831 et seq.), the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 (42 U.S.C. 9858 et seq.), and the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1001 et seq.);

subclause.text: by striking clause (v) and inserting the following:

in subparagraph (C)(i), by inserting and appropriate after rapid; and
by striking subparagraphs (F) and (G) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: for communities that establish and operate a centralized or coordinated assessment system, the extent to which that system—

clause.text: ensures that individuals who are most in need of assistance receive it in a timely manner;

in assessing need under clause (i), uses separate, specific, age-appropriate criteria for assessing the safety and needs of children under 5 years of age, school-age children, unaccompanied youth and young adults between 14 and 24 years of age, and families that are unrelated to the criteria through which an individual qualifies as homeless under section 103;
is accessible to unaccompanied youth and homeless families;
diverts individuals to safe, stable, age-appropriate accommodations; and
includes affordable housing developers, youth service providers, early childhood programs, local educational agencies, and mental health organizations; and

subparagraph.text: such other factors as the Secretary determines to be appropriate to carry out this subtitle in an effective and efficient manner, except that such factors may not have the effect of prioritizing or weighting, unless justified by local data or information contained in a plan submitted under subparagraph (B)—

clause.text: any service with respect to a specific subpopulation of homeless individuals over another; or
any program component or housing or service model over another.

subparagraph.text: by amending paragraph (3) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall require that communities that conduct an annual count of homeless people shall count all homeless individuals identified and reported by any program funded under any provision of this Act or any other Federal statute (as such term is defined in section 401 (42 U.S.C. 11360)).
in section 428 (42 U.S.C. 11386b)—

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall not provide bonuses or other incentives under paragraph (1) that have the effect of prioritizing or weighting, unless justified by local data or information contained in a plan submitted under section 427(b)(1)(B)—

subparagraph.text: any service with respect to a specific subpopulation of homeless individuals over another; or
any program component or housing or service model over another.

paragraph.text: For purposes of this subsection, activities that have been proven to be effective at reducing homelessness generally or reducing homelessness for a specific subpopulation include any activity determined by the Secretary, after providing notice and an opportunity for public comment, to have been proven effective at—

subparagraph.text: reducing homelessness generally;
reducing homelessness for a specific subpopulation;
reducing homelessness in a community for populations overrepresented in any counts conducted in that community under section 427(b)(3); or
achieving homeless prevention, reducing recidivism, and promoting self-sufficiency and independent living.

paragraph.text: In providing bonuses or incentives under paragraph (1), the Secretary shall seek to encourage the implementation of proven strategies and innovation in reducing homelessness among the local priority populations identified in the plan submitted by an applicant under section 427(b)(1)(B). The Secretary shall not implement bonuses or incentives that promote a national priority established by the Secretary.

subparagraph.text: by striking subsection (e); and

paragraph.text: by amending section 434 (42 U.S.C. 11388) to read as follows:

subsection.text: The Secretary shall submit to Congress an annual report, which shall—

paragraph.text: summarize the activities carried out under this subtitle and set forth the findings, conclusions, and recommendations of the Secretary as a result of the activities;
include, for the year preceding the date on which the report is submitted—

subparagraph.text: data required to be made publically available in the report under section 409;
data on programs funded under any other Federal statute; and

paragraph.text: provide information on—

subparagraph.text: the extent to which the data collected under section 427(b)(3) may be duplicative; and
the policies and practices employed to account for such duplication, where applicable, to ensure an accurate point-in-time count.

subsection.text: A report under subsection (a) shall be submitted not later than 4 months after the end of each fiscal year.
